0B2.F.summary: BAWAG Group AG operates as a holding company for BAWAG P.S.K. that provides various banking products and services in Austria, Western Europe, North America, and internationally. The company's Retail & SME segment offers savings, payments, cards, lending, investment, and insurance products and services; small business lending; auto and building society loans and savings; mobile and real estate leasing platforms; factoring services; and portfolio lending. Its Corporates & Public segment provides lending products to international corporates; international real estate financing; corporate, mid-cap, and public lending; and other financial services. The company's Treasury segment offers trading and investment services, such as asset-liability management transactions, including secured and unsecured funding. BAWAG Group AG serves retail, small business, and corporate customers through a managed branch network, as well as through its online and mobile sales channels supported by its customer care center. The company is headquartered in Vienna, Austria.

0B2.SG.summary: BAWAG Group AG operates as a holding company for BAWAG P.S.K. that provides various banking products and services in Austria, Western Europe, North America, and internationally. The company's Retail & SME segment offers savings, payments, cards, lending, investment, and insurance products and services; small business lending; auto and building society loans and savings; mobile and real estate leasing platforms; factoring services; and portfolio lending. Its Corporates & Public segment provides lending products to international corporates; international real estate financing; corporate, mid-cap, and public lending; and other financial services. The company's Treasury segment offers trading and investment services, such as asset-liability management transactions, including secured and unsecured funding. BAWAG Group AG serves retail, small business, and corporate customers through a managed branch network, as well as through its online and mobile sales channels supported by its customer care center. The company is headquartered in Vienna, Austria.

ABE.VI.summary: AB Effectenbeteiligungen, AG invests in companies and securities. Its investments in companies include European small-cap and micro-cap companies, medium-sized companies with growth potential, and pre-initial public offering companies. The company invests in various securities, such as shares on international stock exchanges, fixed-interest securities, and hedging operations. Its investment portfolio includes hospital operators, providers of technological products and services for the industrial sector, building constructors, and infrastructure management software companies. The company was founded in 1997 and is headquartered in Mondsee, Austria.

ADBKF.summary: Addiko Bank AG provides various banking products and services in Croatia, Slovenia, Serbia, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Montenegro, Austria, and Germany. The company operates through Consumer, Mortgage, Small and Medium-Sized Enterprises (SME), Large Corporates, and Public Finance segments. It offers consumer finance; mortgage loans relating to real estate purchase or leveraging private real estate as collateral; public finance; working capital and investment loans, and trade finance products; daily banking services; online deposit services; and online and mobile banking services. As of December 31, 2020, the company operated a total of 168 branches, which include 42 in Croatia, 19 in Slovenia, 60 in Bosnia and Herzegovina, 36 in Serbia, and 11 in Montenegro. It serves private individuals, SMEs, entrepreneurs, profit-oriented and legal entities, and public institutions. Addiko Bank AG is headquartered in Vienna, Austria.

ADKO.VI.summary: Addiko Bank AG provides various banking products and services in Croatia, Slovenia, Serbia, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Montenegro, Austria, and Germany. The company operates through Consumer, Mortgage, Small and Medium-Sized Enterprises (SME), Large Corporates, and Public Finance segments. It offers consumer finance; mortgage loans relating to real estate purchase or leveraging private real estate as collateral; public finance; working capital and investment loans, and trade finance products; daily banking services; online deposit services; and online and mobile banking services. As of December 31, 2020, the company operated a total of 168 branches, which include 42 in Croatia, 19 in Slovenia, 60 in Bosnia and Herzegovina, 36 in Serbia, and 11 in Montenegro. It serves private individuals, SMEs, entrepreneurs, profit-oriented and legal entities, and public institutions. Addiko Bank AG is headquartered in Vienna, Austria.

AW2.MU.summary: Autobank AG provides corporate finance and refinancing services to private and business customers, and car dealers in Austria and Germany. It offers daily and fixed deposits; auto loan and leasing; dealer and inventory financing; and factoring, fleet management, and vehicle trade services, as well as online banking services. The company was founded in 1990 and is headquartered in Vienna, Austria.

BG.VI.summary: BAWAG Group AG operates as a holding company for BAWAG P.S.K. that provides various banking products and services in Austria, Western Europe, North America, and internationally. The company's Retail & SME segment offers savings, payments, cards, lending, investment, and insurance products and services; small business lending; auto and building society loans and savings; mobile and real estate leasing platforms; factoring services; and portfolio lending. Its Corporates & Public segment provides lending products to international corporates; international real estate financing; corporate, mid-cap, and public lending; and other financial services. BAWAG Group AG serves retail, small business, and corporate customers through a managed branch network, as well as through its online and mobile sales channels supported by its customer care center. The company is headquartered in Vienna, Austria.

BKS.VI.summary: BKS Bank AG, together with its subsidiaries, provides various banking products and services. The company operates through Corporate and Business Banking, Retail Banking, and Financial Markets segments. It accepts various deposits products, such as savings, sight, and time deposits; and offers working capital and project finance, lease and export finance, guarantees, and housing and real estate loans, as well as consumer loans. The company also provides advisory, payment, online banking, insurance brokerage, investment options, asset management, custodian, treasury, and international and private banking services, as well as is involved in proprietary trading activity. It operates 63 branches in Austria and internationally. BKS Bank AG was founded in 1922 and is headquartered in Klagenfurt, Austria.

BTS.VI.long_name: Bank für Tirol und Vorarlberg AG
BTS.VI.short_name: BANK F�R TIROL UND VBG AG ST
BTS.VI.summary: Bank fÃ¼r Tirol und Vorarlberg AG, together with its subsidiaries, provides various corporate and retail banking products and services in Austria and internationally. It operates through five segments: Corporate Clients, Private Customers, Institutional Clients and Banks, Leasing, and Cable Cars. The company offers various deposit and loan products, as well as asset management services. It also provides structured financing, investment promotion, loan funding, bank guaranty, export financing, payment transaction, and currency risks, as well as leasing and insurance services. In addition, the company engages in treasury and trading activities; and operation of cable cars, as well as provision of other tourism operations. It serves small, medium, and large companies, as well as business trustees; and private customers, freelancers, and micro-enterprises. Bank fÃ¼r Tirol und Vorarlberg AG was founded in 1904 and is headquartered in Innsbruck, Austria.

EBKDY.summary: Erste Group Bank AG provides a range of banking and other financial services to retail, corporate, real estate, and public sector customers in Austria, Central and Eastern Europe, and internationally. It operates through Retail, Corporates, Group Markets, Asset/Liability Management and Local Corporate Center, Savings Banks, and Group Corporate Center segments. The company provides mortgage and consumer loans, investment products, current accounts, savings products, and credit cards, as well as cross selling products, such as leasing, insurance, and building society products. It also offers account management, payments, digital-banking, and cash logistics services; working capital finance, accounts receivable purchasing, factoring, and structured trade finance; letters of credit, documentary collections, guarantees, equity interests and investments, revolving export credits lines, customer financing, and export guarantee; investment, acquisition and leveraged, project, and commercial real estate finance; and corporate finance advisory and research services. In addition, the company offers trading and market services; trade execution, market making, and short-term liquidity management services; custody, depository, cash management, and trade and export finance services; loan syndication; and asset/liability management services. Further, the company provides portfolio management services and investment funds. As of December 31, 2020, it operated 2,193 branches. The company was founded in 1819 and is headquartered in Vienna, Austria.

OBK.SG.summary: Oberbank AG provides various banking products and services. The company operates through Corporate and Business Banking, Personal Banking, and Financial Markets segments. The Corporate and Business Banking segment provides corporate and business loans, investment finance, and structured finance; private equity and mezzanine capital funds; and leasing, export finance, syndicated loans and international lending, documentary business and guarantees, factoring, and payment services. The Personal Banking segment offers deposit banking, personal accounts and loans, securities services, asset management services, private banking services, and building society savings schemes, as well as card products; and life, risk, accident, and property insurance services. The Financial Markets segment is involved in equity investment and trading activities. It operates through a network of 161 branch offices, including 97 branches in Austria, 28 branches in Germany, 21 branches in the Czech Republic, 12 branches in Hungary, and 3 branches in Slovakia. Oberbank AG was founded in 1869 and is headquartered in Linz, Austria.

OBS.VI.summary: Oberbank AG provides various banking products and services. The company operates through Corporate and Business Banking, Personal Banking, and Financial Markets segments. The Corporate and Business Banking segment provides corporate and business loans, investment finance, and structured finance; private equity and mezzanine capital funds; and leasing, export finance, syndicated loans and international lending, documentary business and guarantees, factoring, and payment services. The Personal Banking segment offers deposit banking, personal accounts and loans, securities services, asset management services, private banking services, and building society savings schemes, as well as card products; and life, risk, accident, and property insurance services. The Financial Markets segment is involved in equity investment and trading activities. It operates through a network of 161 branch offices, including 97 branches in Austria, 28 branches in Germany, 21 branches in the Czech Republic, 12 branches in Hungary, and 3 branches in Slovakia. Oberbank AG was founded in 1869 and is headquartered in Linz, Austria.

RAIFY.summary: Raiffeisen Bank International AG, together with its subsidiaries, provides corporate, retail, and investment banking services. The company offers cross border accounts; and cash management services, such as account, reporting, payment, clearing, settlement, and cash pooling services; electronic banking; and SEPA and cross-border payments to billing solutions. It also provides investor services, including custody and fund administration services, as well as execution services comprising electronic sales trading, direct market access, and fund brokerage services; trade, working capital, export, sustainable, and real estate finance services, as well as commodity and structured trade, project, and supply chain finance products; and cards. In addition, the company offers bank guarantees, sureties, and letters of credit, as well as documentary collection products; hedging, factoring, and leasing services; and fixed income, money market and securities, asset management, and structured products for corporate and institutional customers. Further, it arranges syndicated loans and structure asset based finance transactions; and assists clients in mergers, acquisitions, sales, and privatizations. As of December 31, 2020, the company operated through a network of 1,857 business outlets in Central, Southeastern, and Eastern Europe. Raiffeisen Bank International AG was founded in 1886 and is headquartered in Vienna, Austria.

UIV.VI.summary: Unternehmens Invest AG is a private equity firm specializing in growth capital, expansion, buyout, succession, spin-offs, turnaround, industry consolidation, demerger, and crisis situation investments. The firm prefers to make long-term, buy and build investments in national and international mature medium to larger sized enterprises. The firm seeks to invest primarily in automobile sector. It also holds investments in various growth companies in the technology sector to maintain strategic options for further involvement in this area. The firm considers investments in companies having headquarters in Austria, Germany, and Switzerland. It typically invests in companies with sales revenue between Â15 million ($16.57 million) and Â150 million ($165.7 million) and an EBITDA margin of up to 10 percent. The firm aims for majority investments in its portfolio companies. The firm seeks to make balance sheet investments. The firm prefers investing in B2C and B2B companies. The firm prefers taking an exit either by initial public offering of the shareholding or its sale to a large-scale investor. Unternehmens Invest AG was founded in 1990 and is based in Vienna, Austria. It operates as a subsidiary.

UN9.DE.summary: UNIQA Insurance Group AG operates as an insurance company in Austria, Central and Eastern Europe, and internationally. It operates in UNIQA Austria, UNIQA International, and Reinsurance segments. The company's product portfolio includes life, health, property and casualty, fire and business interruption, household and other property, liability, legal expense, motor TPL and other motor, and other insurance products, as well as marine, aviation, and transport insurance products. It also engages in reinsurance business. The company offers its products and services through various distribution channels, including sales force, general agencies, brokers, banks, and direct sales. The company was formerly known as UNIQA Versicherungen AG and changed its name to UNIQA Insurance Group AG in July 2013. UNIQA Insurance Group AG was founded in 1811 and is based in Vienna, Austria.

VIG.PR.summary: Vienna Insurance Group AG, together with its subsidiaries, provides various insurance products and services in life, health, and property and casualty areas in Central and Eastern Europe. The company provides motor own damage, rail vehicle own damage, aircraft own damage, transport, fire and natural hazards, third party liability, carrier, aircraft liability, general liability, credit, guarantee, legal expenses, assistance, marine, aviation, and travel health insurance products, as well as sea, lake, and river shipping own damage insurance. It also offers reinsurance services. The company sells its products through sales employees, banks, brokers, and agents. It operates in Austria, the Czech Republic, Slovakia, Poland, Romania, the Baltic states, Hungary, Bulgaria, Turkey/Georgia, Albania, Kosovo, Bosnia-Herzegovina, Croatia, North Macedonia, Moldova, Serbia, Ukraine, Germany, and Liechtenstein. The company was founded in 1824 and is based in Vienna, Austria. Vienna Insurance Group AG is a subsidiary of Wiener Stadtische Wechselseitiger Versicherungsverein - VermÃ¶gensverwaltung - Vienna Insurance Group.

VNRFY.summary: Vienna Insurance Group AG, together with its subsidiaries, provides various insurance products and services in life, health, and property and casualty areas in Central and Eastern Europe. The company provides motor own damage, rail vehicle own damage, aircraft own damage, transport, fire and natural hazards, third party liability, carrier, aircraft liability, general liability, credit, guarantee, legal expenses, assistance, marine, aviation, and travel health insurance products, as well as sea, lake, and river shipping own damage insurance. It also offers reinsurance services. The company sells its products through sales employees, banks, brokers, and agents. It operates in Austria, the Czech Republic, Slovakia, Poland, Romania, the Baltic states, Hungary, Bulgaria, Turkey/Georgia, Albania, Kosovo, Bosnia-Herzegovina, Croatia, North Macedonia, Moldova, Serbia, Ukraine, Germany, and Liechtenstein. The company was founded in 1824 and is based in Vienna, Austria. Vienna Insurance Group AG is a subsidiary of Wiener Stadtische Wechselseitiger Versicherungsverein - VermÃ¶gensverwaltung - Vienna Insurance Group.

VVPS.VI.summary: Volksbank Vorarlberg e. Gen. provides banking products and services to private individuals and companies in Austria and Liechtenstein. It offers various accounts and cards; and finance, digital banking, savings and investment products, payment services, and insurance products. The company also provides services related to exchanges and markets. It operates through 14 branches. Volksbank Vorarlberg e. Gen. was founded in 1888 and is headquartered in Rankweil, Austria.

WPB.VI.summary: Wiener Privatbank SE provides various financial products and services to family offices, private investors, institutions, and foundations in Austria and internationally. It's private banking services include investment consulting; portfolio management; wealth planning and securities account analysis; securities, forex, and financial instruments trading; storage, safe custody, and physical precious metals trading; bank safe rentals; foreign currency accounts; and credit cards. The company also provides asset management services comprising fund management; portfolio selection and management; selection of funds, securities, and stocks; and securities trading, brokerage, and research services. In addition, it offers service packages for companies related to capital market issues, including exchange listing/IPO; structuring and settlement of bond issues; and paying agent, securities control, and processing services, as well as corporate support actions. Further, the company engages in developing investment solutions related to real estate, such as retirement investment apartments, real estate investment companies, real estate funds and mortgage bonds, real estate development, facility management, and real estate brokerage services. Wiener Privatbank SE was founded in 1981 and is headquartered in Vienna, Austria.

ZYE1.F.summary: Addiko Bank AG provides various banking products and services in Croatia, Slovenia, Serbia, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Montenegro, Austria, and Germany. The company operates through Consumer, Mortgage, Small and Medium-Sized Enterprises (SME), Large Corporates, and Public Finance segments. It offers consumer finance; mortgage loans relating to real estate purchase or leveraging private real estate as collateral; public finance; working capital and investment loans, and trade finance products; daily banking services; online deposit services; and online and mobile banking services. As of December 31, 2020, the company operated a total of 168 branches, which include 42 in Croatia, 19 in Slovenia, 60 in Bosnia and Herzegovina, 36 in Serbia, and 11 in Montenegro. It serves private individuals, SMEs, entrepreneurs, profit-oriented and legal entities, and public institutions. Addiko Bank AG is headquartered in Vienna, Austria.
